{\rtf1 going to move into looking at editing}
{\rtf1 for organization we're going to focus}
{\rtf1 specifically on editing for paragraph}
{\rtf1 unity so what exactly is paragraph unity}
{\rtf1 well paragraph unity is kind of what you}
{\rtf1 see here in this this little graphic}
{\rtf1 that I've included it's a unit of}
{\rtf1 writing that's got a main idea so that's}
{\rtf1 that top rep that top line is}
{\rtf1 representing that main idea followed by}
{\rtf1 a manageable amount of supporting detail}
{\rtf1 so unit of writing that's got a main}
{\rtf1 idea in a manageable amount of}
{\rtf1 supporting detail so what causes}
{\rtf1 disunity what's the problem that writers}
{\rtf1 typically struggle with one there's no}
{\rtf1 clear controlling idea so you've got a}
{\rtf1 bunch of details but you don't have}
{\rtf1 anything to focus the paragraphs or}
{\rtf1 secondly you've got too much detail in}
{\rtf1 one particular paragraph for just one}
{\rtf1 controlling idea so what I do is going}
{\rtf1 to look at those two examples today and}
{\rtf1 then those two issues today and we're}
{\rtf1 going to look at an example for each so}
{\rtf1 here is a paragraph with no controlling}
{\rtf1 idea so take a second to go ahead and}
{\rtf1 read through this paragraph okay so}
{\rtf1 after you've read through this paragraph}
{\rtf1 you can see a couple things and one is}
{\rtf1 it's got a lot of detail there's a lot}
{\rtf1 of detail in there and it seems to some}
{\rtf1 of it connects and some of it doesn't}
{\rtf1 and so there's a few things we can do a}
{\rtf1 few strategies we can do to find a lack}
{\rtf1 of a controlling idea so one of them is}
{\rtf1 to read the first sentence in the last}
{\rtf1 sentence of a paragraph so we can read}
{\rtf1 the first sentence my degree is}
{\rtf1 highlighted with a concentration in}
{\rtf1 marketing we can read the last sentence}
{\rtf1 this may open up new opportunities for}
{\rtf1 marketing measles}
{\rtf1 so there seems to be a connection}
{\rtf1 between the first sentence in the last}
{\rtf1 sentence but the connection isn't it}
{\rtf1 made explicitly there's no controlling}
{\rtf1 idea that's explicitly connecting these}
{\rtf1 things together another thing that I}
{\rtf1 like to do is what I like to call a meta}
{\rtf1 analysis so basically you're going}
{\rtf1 sentence by sentence and sort of}
{\rtf1 analyzing what the sentence is doing and}
{\rtf1 the way that I like to do is I just like}
{\rtf1 to come up with a one to two word}
{\rtf1 description of what the sentence is}
{\rtf1 doing or what it's describing so if we}
{\rtf1 look at sentence one my BA degree is}
{\rtf1 highlighted with a concentration in}
{\rtf1 marketing I would label that as just as}
{\rtf1 degree so we're describing our degree}
{\rtf1 sentence two after completing my degree}
{\rtf1 I hope to continue cross-country skiing}
{\rtf1 and at the same time work with and}
{\rtf1 working within industry so I labeled}
{\rtf1 that as an aspiration so we talked we're}
{\rtf1 talking about our degree we're talking}
{\rtf1 about our aspirations third sentence}
{\rtf1 because I've been in ski racing}
{\rtf1 community for more than ten years}
{\rtf1 starting in high school with us si and}
{\rtf1 then moving to college racing in the MTM}
{\rtf1 si si I have made and met and made many}
{\rtf1 friends and fellow skiers I labeled that}
{\rtf1 as experience and then sentence for this}
{\rtf1 may open up new opportunities for}
{\rtf1 marketing Neitzel schemes I labeled that}
{\rtf1 as future opportunities so we go from}
{\rtf1 describing my degree or this person}
{\rtf1 describing their degree describing their}
{\rtf1 aspirations for work describing their}
{\rtf1 previous experience and connecting that}
{\rtf1 with their future experiences and so}
{\rtf1 what's kind of missing is tying the}
{\rtf1 degree to the job or tying the degree to}
{\rtf1 future opportunities and so the}
{\rtf1 controlling idea I would argue is that}
{\rtf1 that the degree and the experience and}
{\rtf1 the connections all}
{\rtf1 work together to make this person a}
{\rtf1 great candidate for this particular job}
{\rtf1 so the controlling idea might sound}
{\rtf1 something like this}
{\rtf1 my degree experience and connections}
{\rtf1 provide me with a unique advantage to}
{\rtf1 work for kneazle schemes right so the}
{\rtf1 controlling ideas I've got all of these}
{\rtf1 things and they all work together to}
{\rtf1 make me an ideal candidate okay so}
{\rtf1 that's an example of a paragraph with a}
{\rtf1 lot of detail but no underlying}
{\rtf1 controlling idea by providing this}
{\rtf1 controlling idea we've set the stage for}
{\rtf1 the reader and we've said here's what to}
{\rtf1 expect in the following three or four}
{\rtf1 sentences I'm going to talk about my}
{\rtf1 degree my experience my connection so}
{\rtf1 you're kind of previewing or providing a}
{\rtf1 schema for the reader and so they know}
{\rtf1 what to expect when you provide a}
{\rtf1 controlling idea here is an example of a}
{\rtf1 paragraph with too much detail and I'll}
{\rtf1 give you a few seconds to go ahead and}
{\rtf1 read this on your own}
{\rtf1 okay so I've numbered the sentences in}
{\rtf1 this case and and now that you've read}
{\rtf1 it on your own you probably come up with}
{\rtf1 you know at least two or three places or}
{\rtf1 ideas controlling ideas that are found}
{\rtf1 within this paragraph so let me give you}
{\rtf1 another minute or two to try to come up}
{\rtf1 with what are the two in your head come}
{\rtf1 up with one of the two controlling ideas}
{\rtf1 at least two controlling ideas for this}
{\rtf1 paragraph and then I want you to come up}
{\rtf1 with how you would split this paragraph}
{\rtf1 into multiple paragraphs}
{\rtf1 so this is how I grouped it I group mine}
{\rtf1 into two manageable units and so the top}
{\rtf1 the first sentence is my controlling}
{\rtf1 idea}
{\rtf1 so the first paragraph is to my}
{\rtf1 controlling idea reads to see the}
{\rtf1 difference between academics and}
{\rtf1 practitioners we collected and analyzed}
{\rtf1 data from each stakeholder so the}
{\rtf1 controlling idea is we conducted this}
{\rtf1 study to answer a question and then}
{\rtf1 following it as details sentences 2 3 5}
{\rtf1 6 & 7 so 2 3 5 & 6 I'm sorry then I}
{\rtf1 split the paragraph into another}
{\rtf1 paragraph and my controlling idea was}
{\rtf1 based on the data we analyzed we found}
{\rtf1 differences in perspectives between}
{\rtf1 practitioners and academics so the idea}
{\rtf1 is we found interesting results or there}
{\rtf1 were interesting differences so that's}
{\rtf1 the controlling idea what follows our}
{\rtf1 details on that and that's sentences 7 &}
{\rtf1 8 so in this case we're able to make the}
{\rtf1 paragraph unity and actually cohesion}
{\rtf1 among the paragraphs much stronger by}
{\rtf1 providing two separate controlling ideas}
{\rtf1 and then dividing the details based on}
{\rtf1 those separate controlling ideas so we}
{\rtf1 group them into manageable units of}
{\rtf1 information so the idea is you want one}
{\rtf1 strong clear idea per paragraph}
{\rtf1 so you're editing that's what we're}
{\rtf1 looking for is if you can't re summarize}
{\rtf1 what is the purpose of this paragraph in}
{\rtf1 one sentence then there's probably too}
{\rtf1 much detail so what are some strategies}
{\rtf1 for both editing and teaching paragraph}
{\rtf1 unity so the big thing about editing}
{\rtf1 comprehensively or editing globally here}
{\rtf1 whatever you want to call it is you have}
{\rtf1 to do quite a bit of work book pre}
{\rtf1 editing work work before you actually}
{\rtf1 start to put pen to paper or you start}
{\rtf1 to put your read}
{\rtf1 - paper if you're editing so if you're}
{\rtf1 teaching your students to create more}
{\rtf1 unified paragraphs more cohesive writing}
{\rtf1 one thing that I would encourage you to}
{\rtf1 teach them is to explicitly teach them}
{\rtf1 to just read through the entire document}
{\rtf1 or read through the paragraphs in}
{\rtf1 question and at the very least read}
{\rtf1 through the paragraph before and the}
{\rtf1 paragraph after right and so just coming}
{\rtf1 up with and outlining what's the main}
{\rtf1 idea of these paragraphs like what's the}
{\rtf1 a good guiding question is what is the}
{\rtf1 purpose of this paragraph so there's a}
{\rtf1 lot of reading that you need to do}
{\rtf1 before you actually start editing so}
{\rtf1 that's an important thing to know as an}
{\rtf1 editor and also as a teacher and then}
{\rtf1 secondly I would encourage you to employ}
{\rtf1 this meta analysis method where you're}
{\rtf1 saying what a beach sentence doing like}
{\rtf1 how do they connect to one another and I}
{\rtf1 really like this idea of choosing the}
{\rtf1 word or two to just describe what the}
{\rtf1 sentence is because what can happen is}
{\rtf1 you get bogged down into the details of}
{\rtf1 the sentence and what the meta analysis}
{\rtf1 allows you to do is to just break it}
{\rtf1 down as an editor to its simplest form}
{\rtf1 what is this sentence what is it about}
{\rtf1 and what's the purpose of it so those}
{\rtf1 are the some strategies for editing}
{\rtf1 paragraph unity the biggest one I can I}
{\rtf1 can say as you're moving forward and}
{\rtf1 you're working through some of the}
{\rtf1 practice exercises and some of the}
{\rtf1 homeworks is to make sure you're just}
{\rtf1 reading through and comprehending the}
{\rtf1 paragraph before you start editing it so}
{\rtf1 that's it for now we'll do a quick}
{\rtf1 practice exercise and then we'll be done}
